title: Painting to the Past
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OXNZbX

by Mantabel

Ben Solo is hired on to help in the restoration of the portraits of the lost king and queen. It is a grand redemption to forgotten painter Kylo Ren, who was accused of bewitching and raping the young queen. Upon further investigation, he uncovers the secret affair as else some more intimate portraits of the young queen. Can he help right the wrong that cursed the young painter?

blog.name: southbaystarwars
blog.title: South Bay Star Wars Fan Club
blog.description: The South Bay Star Wars Fan Club (southbaystarwars.com) is your destination for meeting and interacting with other Star Wars fans from throughout the Bay Area who’ve come together to share our passion for our favorite movie franchise. Whether you can’t wait for the new trilogy to begin or you’re simply a fan of the Original Trilogy, Prequels, The Clone Wars, or all that Star Wars has to offer, we’d love for you to join us.

summary: My Last Star Wars Post Until Ep 9
title: My Last Star Wars Post Until Ep 9
body:
I’ve been watching some vids on The Last Jedi (a movie I really liked but had issues with) and it got me thinking about the First Order. It’s weird to be asking this question 2 movies into the new trilogy but…Who Are They?

Yes, this very question and variations of it have been asked in reviews and think pieces alike. But almost a year removed and still there’s no context as to what the First Order is exactly. How did they come to power? What is it they control? Are they a governing body and if so, what do they govern? General Hux referred to the Resistance as war criminals but the First Order blew up an entire star system so it seems like everyone is doing Illegal Things at the moment.

Near as I can tell the organization most resembles a PMC conglomerate (in space) à la Diamond Dogs. But instead of steadily building up geopolitical power by procuring contracts, mining resources and destabilizing known conflict zones with the goal of establishing an independent nation-state where they can do whatever they want, the First Order literally vaporizes entire governments so that no bureaucratic action can be taken against them, leaving them to do whatever they want.

Sure. Fine. That seems like a meathead solution to the equation but go off, mate. This was a thing in JJ’s movie as well where the direction became lazer-focused on the massive new set pieces and mostly treated stuff like motivation as homework. I mean, it is, but it’s key to making your main protagonist(s) that takes up no less than 30% of your movie actually interesting and worth the follow. Extra confusing when this new trilogy is being produced by Disney, a studio with a decades-long history of creating complex, nefarious, charismatic villains.

The decision to kill Snoke in Ep 8 tells me that there was never any plan to reveal anything more of the First Order as they checked down to the Hot Emo Space Wizard. In Rian’s defense, this was the right way to go as Kylo Ren is in my opinion the best character this new story has introduced. His quest for personal meaning coupled with his constant battle against his past life and bloodline will make for some compelling drama and much-needed tension after two whole movies of Snoke’s “ULLLLTIMATE POOOOOWERRRR” gimmick.

Now Kylo Ren is Supreme Leader of the First Order but we still don’t know what that means or, more important, why we should care. He has an enormous fleet of soldiers at his beck-and-call. That’s one thing. There are still Resistance troops floating somewhere in the galaxy. That’s a second thing. And it still leaves a lot of ground to cover. Just like Avengers 4 it seems like they have one of two options for competently ending this story. Make two movies OR make one movie that’s three hours long (or more).

Bring snacks.

I’ve been watching some vids on The Last Jedi (a movie I really liked but had issues with) and it got me thinking about the First Order. It’s weird to be asking this question 2 movies into the new trilogy but…Who Are They?

Yes, this very question and variations of it have been asked in reviews and think pieces alike. But almost a year removed and still there’s no context as to what the First Order is exactly. How did they come to power? What is it they control? Are they a governing body and if so, what do they govern? General Hux referred to the Resistance as war criminals but the First Order blew up an entire star system so it seems like everyone is doing Illegal Things at the moment.

Near as I can tell the organization most resembles a PMC conglomerate (in space) à la Diamond Dogs. But instead of steadily building up geopolitical power by procuring contracts, mining resources and destabilizing known conflict zones with the goal of establishing an independent nation-state where they can do whatever they want, the First Order literally vaporizes entire governments so that no bureaucratic action can be taken against them, leaving them to do whatever they want.

Sure. Fine. That seems like a meathead solution to the equation but go off, mate. This was a thing in JJ’s movie as well where the direction became lazer-focused on the massive new set pieces and mostly treated stuff like motivation as homework. I mean, it is, but it’s key to making your main protagonist(s) that takes up no less than 30% of your movie actually interesting and worth the follow. Extra confusing when this new trilogy is being produced by Disney, a studio with a decades-long history of creating complex, nefarious, charismatic villains.

The decision to kill Snoke in Ep 8 tells me that there was never any plan to reveal anything more of the First Order as they checked down to the Hot Emo Space Wizard. In Rian’s defense, this was the right way to go as Kylo Ren is in my opinion the best character this new story has introduced. His quest for personal meaning coupled with his constant battle against his past life and bloodline will make for some compelling drama and much-needed tension after two whole movies of Snoke’s “ULLLLTIMATE POOOOOWERRRR” gimmick.

Now Kylo Ren is Supreme Leader of the First Order but we still don’t know what that means or, more important, why we should care. He has an enormous fleet of soldiers at his beck-and-call. That’s one thing. There are still Resistance troops floating somewhere in the galaxy. That’s a second thing. And it still leaves a lot of ground to cover. Just like Avengers 4 it seems like they have one of two options for competently ending this story. Make two movies OR make one movie that’s three hours long (or more).

Bring snacks.

blog.name: mandowords
blog.title: Miit'alor
blog.description: I am a descriptivist linguist for the Mando'a language. I show what it can do, not what it MUST do. This is a place for discussion about Mando'a, and Mandalorian society and culture. Feel free to use the head cannons from this blog (or reblogged from others) in your RP or writing. All words and descriptions are taken from the mandoa.org Mandalorian Dictionary. Want to support this blog? Buy me a Kofi? OR buy some Mando'a themed items? Visit our Discord? Blog icon by Rina

title: Ne shab'rud'ni
body:
[Neh shab-ROOD-nee]

Don’t mess with me (extremely strong warning - much stronger than jurkadir - and likely to be followed by violence)

blog.name: ao3feed-starwars
blog.title: Star Wars AO3 Feed
blog.description:
An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

summary: Seeking a Friend to End My World
title: Seeking a Friend to End My World
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2P2JsEV

by coffeeandcigarettesplease

Ben Solo likes to help suicidal people end their life, but he dreams of being able really kill someone. Rey has an inoperable brain tumor, and wants someone to help her end her life before she loses her faculties. When she calls Ben’s fake suicide hotline number, she gets more than she bargained for - and he doesn’t realize that she’s not as desperately depressed as he thinks.

Dark Ben, sad Rey, set in 1997, featuring our favorite hits from the decade as well as a cross country road trip and angst. Will not be a happy fic.

Words: 2294, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Explicit
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Rey, Ben Solo, Rose Tico
  • Relationships: Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren
  • Additional Tags: Dead Dove: Do Not Eat, Suicide, Suicidal Ideation, compassionate killing, Brain tumor, Family Drama, Road Trip, ben wants to kill people


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2P2JsEV
